entry.title: Upload to Google Photos fails if directory is renamed (macOS)
entry.content:
I was uploading a folder of 29 photos to Google Photos and renamed the source directory on my computer in the middle. The first 13 photos were successfully uploaded but the remaining 16 failed. I’m not entirely sure whether this is a bug in Google Photos or Chromium, but on macOS, applications are supposed to be able to handle files and directories being renamed while they’re open.
I am using Version 121.0.6167.184 (Official Build) (x86_64) on Sonoma 14.3.1.

entry.title: Regression: Chrome is crashing upon clicking on Side Panel while syncing
entry.content:
Chrome Version : 123.0.6303.0 (Official Build) (arm64) (cohort: Stable) Revision : 2381c97e4ff5eb528e8b4354fae1b01d38e4e55a-refs/branch-heads/6303@{#1}
OS: Win(11arm)
Crash ID : 8bb28b7266b6a21b (Win 11arm)
Pre Conditions: None
Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch Chrome 2. Turn on Sync 3. While chrome is syncing, click rapidly and constantly on the sidepanel (both normal and incognito window's) 4. Observe, Chrome is crashing
Actual Result : Chrome is crashing upon constant rapid clicking on the Side Panel while syncing
Expected Result : Chrome should not crash
Please find the screencast link attached below..!
Actual Result: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1etwVyyCqBcWQJdBOkQP_BVoZ6CuqwjKL/view?usp=drivesdk
Note: 1. Will Provide Bisect and break info soon 2. Will provide other OS's details soon
Thank You

entry.title: Horizontal bar present in element tab is not visible in the middle when we drag it towards right to left.
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 123.0.6300.3 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable Installs & Version Pins) 57295a4890d5d5f76872ed19abaf85a3c85876a6-refs/branch-heads/6300@{#9}
OS : Win(10,11)
Preconditions: None
Steps to reproduce: 1.Launch Chrome and Open NTP 2.Right Click and then Inspect 3.Go to Element Tab 4.Drag the Styles Bar Towards Left side 6.Observe that, Horizontal bar present in element tab is not visible in the middle when we drag it towards right to left.
Actual Result:Horizontal bar present in element tab is not visible in the middle when we drag it towards right to left. Expected Result:Horizontal bar should be visible throughout the dragging it to left side.
This issue exists from M-113 onwards .So,raising it as a NR issue.
Please refer to the Attached screencast link below: https://screenpal.com/watch/cZnD11VddUF
Notes: 1)This issue able to repro on Stable #122.0.6261.49, Beta #122.0.6261.6 and Dev RC#123.0.6300.3 2)As this being a Non-Regression issue,changing the status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed.
Thanks..!!

entry.title: Regression: Profile icon is not loaded properly(Image is seen broken) for New tab page
entry.content:
Chrome Version: Ash-chrome M123 canary 123.0.6291.0/15779.0.0 on eve(poppy) device Lacros Version :lacros canary 123.0.6304.0 [lacros only] OS: chrome
Details: 1)Accounts: Corp account and Test account 2)Enterprise Enrolled: Yes, enrolled with Corp account 3)Devices: Non-corp device Eve(poppy) - X86/lacros 64 Babymega(coral) -x86/lacros 64 corp-device Dratini(Hatch) device -x86/lacros 64
4)Repro on Ash-chrome: yes
5)Mode: Device is in Verified mode
6)Frequency: Always
Enabled the lacros flags #lacros-stability = canary #lacros-only = Enabled #lacros-availability-ignore = Enabled
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1)Launch Lacros 2) Try to open a NTP and observe the profile icon
What is the expected result? Profile icon should view properly
What happens instead? Observed Profile icon is not loaded properly(breakage of image is seen)
Note: 1)Issue observed on ash-chrome as well lacros 2)Checked connecting with LAN connection and wifi,but still image is seen broken 3)Tried restarting the device but still observed the same 4)Oserved issue only with the NTP(new tab page)
Attaching listnr feedback report: https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91565537802

entry.title: Ill in SkAbort_FileLine
entry.content:
Detailed Report: https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=6377015223975936
Fuzzer: inferno_twister Job Type: linux_asan_chrome_media Platform Id: linux
Crash Type: Ill Crash Address: 0x59f7b2927744 Crash State: SkAbort_FileLine SkBitmap::allocPixels SkBitmap::allocPixels
Sanitizer: address (ASAN)
Crash Revision: https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=linux_asan_chrome_media&revision=1232806
Reproducer Testcase: https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=6377015223975936
Issue filed automatically.
To reproduce this, please build the target in this report and run it against the reproducer testcase. Please use the GN arguments provided at bottom of this report when building the binary.
If you have trouble reproducing, please also export the environment variables listed under "[Environment]" in the crash stacktrace.
If you have any feedback on reproducing test cases, let us know at https://forms.gle/Yh3qCYFveHj6E5jz5 so we can improve.

entry.title: [CSS Highlights] Text with custom highlights applied loses its color upon selecting
entry.content:
Demo: https://codepen.io/bramus/full/VwRqGVo
The code snippets in that demo have Custom Highlights applied. Selecting any of the text makes the text lose the color information.
Tested in both Chrome 121 and Chrome 123.
In Safari this works as expected: there, the Custom Highlights are preserved.

entry.title:
Tests are failing: browser_test_base.cc(610): Expected equality of these values:
 expected_exit_code_
 Which is: 0
 ContentMain(std::move(content_main_params))
 W...
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): browser_test_base.cc(610): Expected equality of these values:\n expected_exit_code_\n Which is: 0\n ContentMain(std::move(content_main_params))\n Which is: 1
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/NetInfoNetworkQualityEstimatorHoldbackBrowserTest.EffectiveConnectionTypeChangeNotified/All.1 - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/WebAppBrowserTest.PopOutDisabledInIncognito - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/ClientHintsBrowserTestForMetaTagTypes.ClientHintsFollowedByNoClientHint/All.0 - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/PrivacySandboxPromptHelperTest.NoPromptRequired - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/PlusAddressCreationDialogTest.DialogClosed
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - test variant(s) are being exonerated (ignored) in presubmit
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/b0ded05176d6c34fc4fe7e5f4e7f7b6c
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: Migrate chromium graphics test on Skylab to CFT
entry.content: The current lxc container based test execution is too old to support. CrOS infra requires users to migrate their tests to CFT. See the umbrella bug, b/307657497. This is for tracking the chromium graphics tests.

entry.title: Screenshot's initial position is incorrect
entry.content: Currently the initial position is (-W * 0.25 * 0.85, 0). It supposed to be (-W * 0.25, 0). Need to change how the progress is mapped in PhysicsModel. It's a minor change. ``` finger pos 0 -> W active page 0 -> 0.85W screenshot -0.25W -> 0 ```

entry.title: rust compile errors in rust roll
entry.content:
https://crrev.com/c/5296403
e.g.
https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/linux-chromeos-dbg/5192/overview
``` RUST obj/third_party/boringssl/bssl_crypto/libbssl_crypto_bssl_crypto.rlib python3 ../../build/rust/rustc_wrapper.py --rustc=../../third_party/rust-toolchain/bin/rustc --depfi...(too long) error: method `as_ffi_void_ptr` is never used --> ../../third_party/boringssl/src/rust/bssl-crypto/src/lib.rs:104:8 | 102 | trait FfiMutSlice { | ----------- method in this trait 103 | fn as_mut_ffi_ptr(&mut self) -> *mut u8; 104 | fn as_ffi_void_ptr(&mut self) -> *mut c_void { | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: `-D dead-code` implied by `-D warnings` = help: to override `-D warnings` add `#[allow(dead_code)]`
error: associated function `from_ptr_mut` is never used ```
and https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/dawn-android-arm-deps-rel/12725/overview
``` [10213/54252] RUST local_rustc_sysroot/lib/rustlib/armv7-linux-androideabi/lib/libstd_std.rlib FAILED: local_rustc_sysroot/lib/rustlib/armv7-linux-androideabi/lib/libstd_std.rlib "python3" "../../build/rust/rustc_wrapper.py" --rustc=../../third_party/rust-toolchain/bin/rustc --d...(too long) error: `futex_condvar::Condvar::new` is not yet stable as a const fn --> ../../third_party/rust-toolchain/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/std/src/sync/condvar.rs:127:26 | 127 | Condvar { inner: sys::Condvar::new() } | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = help: const-stable functions can only call other const-stable functions
error: `futex_mutex::Mutex::new` is not yet stable as a const fn ```

entry.title: [Win] System media controls don't follow dPWA sessions when web-app-system-media-controls-win is DISABLED
entry.content:
Affected browsers: Chrome, Edge
OS: Windows 10 and 11
**Repro steps** 1. Navigate to ![](chrome://flags/#enable-web-app-system-media-controls-win) and DISABLE the feature 2. Navigate to ![](https://liahiscock.github.io/PWA/MediaControls/App1) and install as a PWA using the omnibox install button. Click the play button in the PWA. 3. Open the Windows control center from the taskbar (win 11) -- - expected: to see media controls for the PWA - actual: no controls
Attached a video showing the issue on Windows 11.
A previous bug fix (linked below) ignored PWA media sessions when searching for the "Active" session so that the browser could utilize a media controller that automatically followed the active session, but the fix forgot to add a feature flag check.
https://issues.chromium.org/u/1/issues/41490736

entry.title: Hoteles.com incorrectly getting a "did you mean xyz" message
entry.content:
Hi,
Hotel.com, Hoteles.com and Hoteis.com are all legitimate domains for Hotels.com for different geographies yet we see this message on the site. can you please action on removing this message for chrome users.

entry.title: Better O4 diagnostic tools
entry.content:
This is based on the experience from enterprise customer support. Currently O4 has tools for policy dump and update check. But they have limitations. Things to consider:
1. [ ] Show the device management token status (enrollment token, dm token, and possibly the sources as well). 2. [ ] Show current downloaded CBCM policies. 3. [ ] Current resolved policies status. 4. [ ] *Force* an update check. 5. [ ] Show registered apps and their status 6. [ ] Maybe collect machines status (registry keys on windows, syslogs on macOS etc). 7. [ ] Combine all the functionality into one single tool, and make it part of the build.

entry.title:
Tests are failing: safe_browsing_blocking_page_test.cc(3839): Expected equality of these values:
 2
 report.resources_size()
 Which is: 1
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): safe_browsing_blocking_page_test.cc(3839): Expected equality of these values:\n 2\n report.resources_size()\n Which is: 1
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/SafeBrowsingBlockingPageAsyncChecksTimingTest.PostCommitInterstitialReportThreatDetails/CheckCompleteAfterNavigationFinish.1 - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/SafeBrowsingBlockingPageAsyncChecksTimingTest.PostCommitInterstitialReportThreatDetails/CheckCompleteAfterNavigationFinish.0 - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/SafeBrowsingThreatDetailsPrerenderBrowserTest.DontContainPrerenderingInfoInThreatReport/All.1 - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/SafeBrowsingThreatDetailsPrerenderBrowserTest.DontContainPrerenderingInfoInThreatReport/All.0
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - many gardened builders are failing
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/d5346dbe254f8585a364dd938603def9
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: match canvas synthetic capture frame rate to streams
entry.content:
when canvas switches over to synthetic timing for drawing, it currently uses a hardcoded value of 16 msec. this should match the requested capture frame rate.
note that, right now, this only affects mac and only when the tab is hidden, since other platforms use OnBeginFrame from viz to match the display, even when the tab is hidden.

entry.title: Unknown links in Play Services and WIPO authorised
entry.content:
Chrome Version: (copy from chrome://version) Lacros Version (if applicable): (copy from chrome://version) OS: (e.g. Win10, MacOS 10.12, etc...)
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) remove the unknown links please (2) Applicable laws protocols for their liabilities (3)EULA and WIPO authorised for their Tribunals in their own War Crimes
What is the expected result? Stuck like Chuck in the chomo film affiliates who now met their Tribunals
What happens instead?
Please use hotlists and text to provide additional information.
If this is a regression (i.e., worked before), please consider using the bisect tool (https://www.chromium.org/developers/bisect-builds-py) to help us identify the root cause and more rapidly triage the issue.
For graphics-related bugs, please copy/paste the contents of the about://gpu page at the end of this report.

entry.title: ContaminationDelayBrowserTest failing on MSAN bots
entry.content:
e.g. https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/41283/overview
[ RUN ] ContaminationDelayBrowserTest.IgnoresSameOrigin 2024-02-15T22:02:04.774759Z WARNING content_browsertests[30103:30103]: [field_trial_util.cc(105)] Field trial config study skipped: PrefetchRedirects.Enabled (some of its features are already overridden) 2024-02-15T22:02:04.837159Z WARNING content_browsertests[30103:30103]: [audio_manager_linux.cc(53)] Falling back to ALSA for audio output. PulseAudio is not available or could not be initialized.
DevTools listening on ws://127.0.0.1:33107/devtools/browser/0cef1e14-578d-4c4e-a37a-604b40125c7c 2024-02-15T22:02:05.146888Z WARNING content_browsertests[30288:30288]: [gpu_init.cc(556)] Using passthrough command decoder. NOTE: This log is to help triage feedback reports and does not by itself mean there is an issue. 2024-02-15T22:02:05.168604Z WARNING content_browsertests[30288:30288]: [gpu_memory_buffer_support_x11.cc(49)] dri3 extension not supported. 2024-02-15T22:02:05.222888Z WARNING content_browsertests[30288:30288]: [sandbox_linux.cc(418)] InitializeSandbox() called with multiple threads in process gpu-process. 2024-02-15T22:02:05.579493Z ERROR content_browsertests[30297:30385]: [default_socket.cc(59)] /run/perfetto/ exists but cannot be accessed. Falling back on /tmp/ (errno: 13, Permission denied) base/test/test_future.h:204: Failure Failed RunLoop::Run() timed out. Timeout set at ProxyRunTestOnMainThreadLoop@content/public/test/browser_test_base.cc:851.

entry.title: Tests are failing: browser_test_utils.cc(2104): Value of: accessibility_waiter.WaitForNotification()\n Actual: false\nExpected: true
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): browser_test_utils.cc(2104): Value of: accessibility_waiter.WaitForNotification()\n Actual: false\nExpected: true
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/PDFOCRIntegrationTest.NoOcrResultOnBlankImagePdf/All.1 - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/PDFOCRIntegrationTest.HelloWorld/All.1 - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/AutofillAccessibilityTest.TestAutocompleteState
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - test variant(s) are being exonerated (ignored) in presubmit
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/9b88b28653cfd0cb21857e026e1dee8a
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: ARIA spec update to ignore aria-hidden=true on root document elements (e.g., body/html elements)
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. put an aria-hidden=true attribute on the html or body element of a web page 2. review accessibility tree 3. all non-focusable elements are marked as ignored # Problem Description The ARIA spec is updating with a new requirement where user agents must ignore the aria-hidden=true attribute when used on the HTML or BODY element of a web page. The specific text: To prevent authors erroneously hiding entire window-rendered documents only to those using assistive technology, user agents MUST NOT expose the hidden state to assistive technologies if it is specified on the root element or the host language element that represents the contents of the primary document in view. For instance, the html or body elements in an HTML document, or the root svg element if it is rendered as its own primary document in the browser window. If authors were to specify aria-hidden="true" on the opening tag for an embedded document, for instance on a math or svg embedded within an HTML document, user agents would still be expected to hide these elements from assistive technologies. A basic test case, such as, would result in no ignored elements, as the aria-hidden=true on the html element would be ignored.

hello world

my content

a hyperlink ARIA PR 1880 - https://github.com/w3c/aria/pull/1880 # Summary ARIA spec update to ignore aria-hidden=true on root document elements (e.g., body/html elements) # Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: OneCopyCanvasCapture broken?
entry.content:
I noticed Meet effects processing causes ARGB readbacks from HTMLCanvasElement::NotifyListenersCanvasChanged, see https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4Hqs6Mqv3WPXdWX and pprof https://screenshot.googleplex.com/6ivxQYrybQoQGDu. It seems one-copy canvas capture isn't happening on my mac.
This was after noticing similar problems on an alderlake i5, following up tomorrow with results from that machine.
Tried Metal/OpenGL backends, same result.
about:gpu: attached.

entry.title: Test bug for Chromium GSoC component
Test spin-eventloop-not-longtask.html fails intermittently on Linux
entry.content:
Test external/wpt/longtask-timing/spin-eventloop-not-longtask.html is flaky on Linux and fails intermittently with error:
`This is a testharness.js-based test. Harness Error. harness_status.status = 1 , harness_status.message = Uncaught TypeError: Assignment to constant variable. Harness: the test ran to completion.`
Please see: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja%3A%2F%2F%3Ablink_wpt_tests%2Fexternal%2Fwpt%2Flongtask-timing%2Fspin-eventloop-not-longtask.html

entry.title: MacOS: Render artefacts appear, and persist when hovering elements and animating box-shadow.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. load repro codepen: https://codepen.io/glomotion/pen/BabMzxv?editors=1100 2. hover each of the buttons 3. observe remaining pixel artefacts
# Problem Description The buttons render correctly when you first load the page. However when hovering, strange pixel dot artefacts appear, at varying levels of brightness, depending on how quickly you hover them. Can provide screenshots and video of the issue happening if it helps.
# Additional Comments Cant replicate this inside of Firefox or Safari.
# Summary MacOS: Render artefacts appear, and persist when hovering elements and animating box-shadow.
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>Animation
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: Blintz security daily query rule: overactive "security nag" rule/check
entry.content:
The Blintz security_nag_check.py is over-actively pinging on security bugs that were recently updated (e.g. https://issues.chromium.org/u/0/issues/41493884#comment22).
I know we are looking at this right now, but filing a bug to track in the interim.
